result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Matter is dismissed and read into case:  14CF1387

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin R Mech

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Justin R Mech in court with attorney Joseph Smith by Atty. Stilling.  

Matter is dismissed and read into case:  14CF1387

filed by Attorney Smith requesting that this matter be set on 2/15/16 with the defendant's other matters for a plea and sentencing.

2/11/16 - Court grants request and matter rescheduled to 2/15/16 @ 3:15 p.m.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Justin R Mech in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Justin R Mech in court. 
Court vacates the stayed warrant.

State will be issuing additional charges - (not charged as of today).
Defendant wants to go to to the Public Defender's office.
Defendant referred to the P.D.'s Office.

  Hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Justin R Mech not in court.  
Case scheduled for 9:30 am. and Matter called @ 10:08 am.

Court orders a stayed warrant to the next court date.
MANDATORY APPEARANCE BY THE DEFENDANT IS REQUIRED OR A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED.  
Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 10:15 am.


Matter recalled @ 11:11 am. 
Defendant in custody on a PO Hold.
All other appearances are the same as above.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim Alexzandra B listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.

Defendant Justin R Mech in court, in custody.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.
